Who is Alexis Maas?

Alexis Maas was catapulted into the limelight because of her marriage to Johnny Carson, the deceased talk show host. She was born on July 15th, 1952, in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, United States. Unfortunately, nothing about her early life and family background is in the limelight.

Alexis Maas' profession

As the wife of a wealthy man, Alexis wasn't forced to pursue a profession to fend for her needs. She was reportedly a former stock brokerage employee. However, like most celebrity wives, her husband's career overshadowed hers.

Johnny Carson was a renowned TV presenter and talk show host. He was known by many as the King of Late Night Television. He was active in his professional career between 1950 and 1994.

How did Johnny Carson and Alexis Maas meet?

Alexis Maas became famous because of marrying Johnny Carson. The couple met in the 1980s and dated for a while before finally tying the knot. They tied the knot in a quiet ceremony at his Malibu beach home on June 20th, 1987.

Alexis was 35 years old when he married the famous TV show host and presenter. Her husband was 62 years old at the time. Nonetheless, their huge age gap could not prevent them from pursuing romance.

Superior Court Judge William P. officiated their wedding. It was attended by a few of their friends and family members. Their honeymoon made headlines as they reportedly spent over $6.5 million during their vacation.

Was Alexis Maas married before?

Alexis Maas, unlike her husband, was never married before. Unfortunately, all the previous marriages ended in divorce. Carson first married a fellow student, Jody Morrill Wolcott, in 1949. The couple had three children: Chris, Ricky, and Cory.

When he finalised his divorce in 1963, he married model Joanne Copeland a few months later. Their marriage ended in 1972 before he married Joanna Holland. This marriage also ended in divorce in 1983.

How did Alexis Maas' husband die?

Johnny Carson died on January 23rd, 2005, at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles. He died at the age of 79 years. His fans and followers were shocked at the announcement of his untimely death.

It was revealed that the cause of his death was the effects of emphysema. He had been a heavy smoker for several decades.

It is unclear how much money Alexis inherited from her husband. Therefore, it is impossible to estimate Alexis Maas' net worth. Johnny and Alexis were married for about 18 years before his untimely death. The couple enjoyed a luxurious lifestyle.

At the time of his demise, Johnny Carson was worth a whopping $300 million. His two sons, Cory and Chris (who are still alive), and his wife shared this fortune. About $156 million was left to The Johnny Carson Foundation.
